inn1.comm: and Porterfield is bowled first ball! How about that for a loosener ... It was a devilish delivery to get first up, Lee bang on line and up around 90mph, the ball seaming back and thudding into the top of off stump
and there's a big lbw shout first ball, a full delivery swinging back - maybe doing just enough to miss leg, as the umpire decides

no doubt about this one, off stump out of the ground again! Lee is marauding through Ireland's left-handers, seaming the ball back in at express pace and after three balls the scorecard shows two blobs
pushed through outside off on a good length, left alone
length ball, pushed towards cover
good length outside off, again O'Brien is able to leave
full and swinging away, Stirling - who watched the first-over carnage from the other end - leaves
slides down the leg side this time
length ball, on the stumps
good length and leaving the right-hander, who swishes and misses
defended in front of off stump
tight line, Stirling gets behind the ball in defence
touch shorter and Stirling tries to chop back down the wicket but Hilfenhaus gathers comfortably
length ball angled across outside off, left alone
drifts on to the pads and flicked fine for the first run off the bat
bit of width to Stirling, slightly full and slashed hard and high over point for a boundary - that'll settle Irish nerves a touch
leg-stump line, the ball rising off a length and hitting the batsman's thigh pad
good length, around off, driven and inside-edged into the leg side for a couple
back of a length, Stirling waves a bat outside off but fails to connect
sliding across the lefty, dabbed behind point for one
good length, tight line on off, defended into the off side
drifts on to the pads, half-volley length and Stirling doesn't miss out, punching firmly in front of midwicket for four
pitched up outside off and crunched through the covers for four this time - Stirling going after Hilf early doors
pulls his length back, pushed square on the off side
off-stump line, defended on the front foot
teasing line and length from Lee, inducing a play-and-a-miss
length ball, on off stump, defended back down the pitch
vicious, full in-ducker that then nips away off the seam to beat O'Brien's nervy prod - he'd have needed a snow plough to hit that
bouncer, gets up at the batsman, who does well to adjust and scoop it round the corner for one
back-of-a-length ball outside off, driven on the up through square
length ball that rises sharply, hitting the bat near the splice
full and on line, defended in front of off stump
angled across and dabbed into a gap for one
length ball, defended towards point
short of a good length, bit of width and hacked behind square for a single to third man
line and length, sliding across O'Brien, who defends into the covers
back of a length, steepling past the batsman as he tucks his bat inside the line
and Stirling steals a single straight away
length ball, tapped into the off side
flicked off the hips through square
length ball, in the corridor, squirted in the air short of cover-point
touch shorter, tries to swing through the line but miscues short of cover
full and straight, Stirling shuffles across and lofts the ball over midwicket
defended into the off side on the front foot
touch shorter, darting away and steered towards gully
slides his line down the leg side and O'Brien whips this off his hips, lovely timing and the ball races to the boundary
pushed through on a good length outside off, veering further on its way past the batsman, who leaves
length delivery, pushed into the off side coming forward
short and at the body again, nudged through square
on the stumps, pushed into the on side
low arm, off-stump line, blocked
good length ball, forward defensive to extra-cover
pitched up on off, driven back down the track and Hilfenhaus throws himself to his right to make the stop
pulls his length back, pushed square on the off side
length ball on off, chopped towards cover
full and straight, driven into the ground and fielded by Cummins in his follow-through
pitched up on off again, clipped square but straight to the fielder
full but too much width this time and Stirling is able to get down and clatter a drive wide of third man

superb catch at slip and Stirling perishes! Cummins put it on a good length outside off, drawing a thick edge as Stirling tried to check his drive, and Clarke flew to his right from first slip - like the canary he's dressed as - to grasp the ball one-handed
full toss, blocked
better length, pushed into the off side
good length, played into the off side
in the corridor outside off, thick edge low through vacant third slip
defended in line with off stump
on the stumps and prodded back on to the wicket
